name: SDCC
description: SDCC is a retargettable, optimizing Standard C (ANSI C89, ISO C99, ISO C11, ISO C23) compiler suite that targets the Intel MCS51 based microprocessors (8031, 8032, 8051, 8052, etc.), Maxim (formerly Dallas) DS80C390 variants, Freescale (formerly Motorola) HC08 based (hc08, s08), Zilog Z80 based MCUs (Z80, Z180, SM83, Rabbit 2000, 2000A, 3000A, TLCS-90, R800), Padauk (pdk14, pdk15), STMicroelectronics STM8, MOS 6502 and WDC 65C02.
The support for MOS 6502 is quite new and limited.
pros: Mature compiler with a long history.
cons: Versions 4.4.0 and later fails to produce a working binary for the C64.
Some benchmarks and tests do not complete normally, e.g. zlib.
